caption: One the Hidden treasures in the area. Make sure to visit the hidden Garden in the back it's totally worth it

A wonderful authentic Italian-style restaurant. Meals carefully prepared and delivered by a friendly staff, we've never been disappointed.  The menu seems to change at least weekly, bring your dictionary or app because the chef is always coming up with new dishes no-one has ever heard of.
Love Popina! So grateful they have their garden so we can keep enjoying the amazing food and wine during these crazy times.
Amazing food and service! The Hot chicken and the rigatoni was AMAZING! Will definitely come again! It's super safe during Covid-19 and I appreciate their outside dining experience.
Great place to eat during the pandemic(and other times as well!).  Delicious food, friendly people, loveLy garden.  Get the hot chicken.

absolutely delicious, wonderful hospitality. the drinks, appetizers and entrees were all top notch and delicious. gratuity included is great and should be standard across all restaurants. thank you for the wonderful dinner.

A splendid spread of options for dining in the backyard or grabbing for home.  Interesting and delicious wine selection and pantry staples.  My favorite meal prep lockdown what the hot chicken and it's a solid friend still.  If you can get a chess pie or slice you will be in heaven and the pastas are simple, caring, and delicious.  A solid spot to indulge.
Wonderful restaurant full of passion. Support this place because the food is delicious and the wine selection is great . 10/10! .. support your neighborhood restaurant!
A great COVID-adjusted experience. They take safety very seriously and it makes the whole experience much more enjoyable because you can focus on the great food and delicious wine.

Popina is a really amazing local joint. My wife and I discovered the spot about a year ago and returned this past weekend for a little weekend outing during covid. They are taking lots of precautions, but the food is just as delicious and the service is just as wonderful. The hot chicken is truly fantastic and their campari cake is memorable. Make sure to ask for a wine recommendation, because they really know their stuff. Overall, great food, great service, and a wonderful outdoor space. Safe to say, Popina is a must-visit (and then again, and again, and again).

The wine list is really fun and will appease both somms and novices. The hot chicken was incredible, a perfectly crispy crust around a tender peace of chicken. Their outside space is quite large as well.

Had a wonderful Covid-Date-Night here a few weeks ago.  I've been wanting to check it out for some time. Super careful with only having 1 person in the shop at a time and limited interactions with staff.  They even built the tip into the pricing so after you pay & get your food, you can just leave.  The seating was spacious and 50/50 had nice atmosphere (50% in a cute garden, 50% in an adjoining alley) but these days who can complain?  Food was delicious, they were out of the brisket meatballs so we will need to return soon to try and get our hands on those.
Great outdoor space, amazing wine selection and serious food, tasty and hospitality. What else? Run...
Excellent meal !!
They serve large dishes and for reasonable rates. very kind owner. Never disappointing.
I had an amazing time at this spot. We loved the nice environment and the menu. The waiters were very attentive. I am happy we ultimately decided to visit this spot.
Everything was more or less ok. The ditalini special's pasta was incredibly undercooked. It was almost crunchy. The apple whiskey cocktail was terrific.

We enjoyed ourselves at Popina! The service was excellent. I absolutely loved the sweet potato dish with the hot pickled peppers, aioli, bitter greens, and capers. So good! My boyfriend  swooned over the hot Chicken Milanese. He would have liked more dressing on it but it's was very tasty. I enjoyed the pasta with the collard greens and what's was called Ham on the menu. It was definitely roast pork or fresh ham and not cured ham but it was delicious nonetheless. It was a little loud but we would definitely go back early.

I got so many recommendations for this place. Maybe we came in on a bad day? But nothing we ate was great and there is something going on with the acoustics inside. It was so incredibly loud and tightly packed.  When I mentioned my experience to friends who have been, they're consistently surprised. So I'd be open to trying again, but this was my first impression.

Really delicious, simple food. Waterfront view of lower Manhattan with a small seating area fantastic for family/couples/friends to share a meal. Staff are wonderful at answering questions regarding the food and decor (make sure to ask. interesting info).
Very solid food, and great value, appreciated the negroni in a bottle and hot chicken, dessert was quite good as well

How could such a relatively small menu have such difficult choices? Luckily, it’s impossible to go wrong.  But definitely, for the winter, order the lamb sausage.  If you have four spicy people, go for the hot chicken. We couldn’t decide, so we’re taking stuff home and passing out. Thanks once more to our server, Brittany, who was as amazing as the food and wine we had!

Update: This was a one star, but I felt the need to update because the owner reached out after my review. He was very kind and offered us to come by again. I very much liked the location/ambiance so I do hope we had a one-off experience.  ———  Brussel sprouts were quite tasty. The space is intimate and cute. But the pastas (rigatoni and sausage Ragu) were so salty, it was near inedible. We did it eat it (because we are non-confrontational humans) but immediately went to the store to buy water to chug for the rest of the evening.
This restaurant gives first-rate service and yummy menu. One of my favourite spots in the city. The drinks and food arrived quickly and the rates were economical. Highly recommended.
A step above other Brooklyn Italian. Special things are happening here. Don't miss it.

This was a repeat of this other place Lupa in the city and Lantern as well. The food is just not that good. I know it isn't what expensive tastes like because Buttermilk Channel is pricey but great. The service was really nice, the waiter was certain to ask about allergies, good stuff. His food according to him was alright but the portion was definitely not for the price. Anyhow, I'd recommend it if you're certain these types of restaurants do right by your palate, otherwise, your choice.
Great negroni and tapas in Brooklyn
The staff was great and that's where the stars are being dedicated. The food is probably 3 stars, I'm far from picky and nothing wowed me.
One of my go-to places to grab some food. fantastic location, neat, and good customer service. Keep it up!
Such an amazing gem! Great dinner menu and beautiful outdoor space with bocce and picnic tables.
Such a good back yard and the friendliest staff.
Special place. Fantastic menu of rotating seasonally focused specials and homemade hits. Brilliant wine list.
Awesome.  Come.
The wine recommendation from James was awesome. We did the early day brunch and sampled everything. Pasta and chicken was unreal. Tasty on every level!  Will be coming back soon.
Best meal this year.  Hot chicken milano was insanely perfect and the pappardelle with country ham and greens was outstanding.
Most underrated restaurant in Brooklyn. Brilliant food and drink. Beautiful backyard. Wonderful staff. Go

Small plates but very good.  Cozy place.  Chef comes out to say hello.  Like the southern accents.  Am not sure if I will come out of my way to go back.  But really enjoyed the time while I was there.

Popina is a delight and easily cracks the top 5 all-around restaurants in south Brooklyn.  The stand-out Italian-heavy wine list is both approachable and innovative; we learn something new each dinner there and James is a capable and friendly guide.  The reserve list is remarkable. Chris’ menu manages the impressive feat of being original and familiar simultaneously.  The Southern and Italian fusion goes well past clever (though the menu reflects a clear sense of humor) to introduce dishes that seem to shuffle culinary memories together into a well-seasoned, harmonious hand.  ham hock collards papardelle is a revelation.  the “hot chicken” milanese with a buttermilk radicchio is a sensational entree, an elevated guilty pleasure.  even the little things (cacio e pepe butter !) are creative and well executed.  Popina is the sort of neighborhood staple that is worth traveling to, where a party of 4 should just order everything on the menu, and then come back the following week to refresh...
Great atmosphere- especially if it's nice out and the backyard is open, a hidden gem in the neighborhood! The arancini is incredible
Great food intamate service

Best kept secret in the area. The food here is consistently phenomenal! I particularly enjoy the always creative pastas and you can never go wrong with the hot chicken milanese. On top of that it has undoubtedly one of the best wine lists in all of NYC at great prices and the staff are all welcoming and fantastic. Highly recommended.
Cool place

Perfect affordable cooking. Few places can grill a fish (mackerel) in a way that brings out the natural flavors and keeps the meat moist. The papardelle asked constantly for another bite. The chess pie was relatively light.  The only downside was that on Saturday evening the indoors space is extremely loud. I wish they did something about that, as I could barely hear the other person, marring an otherwise excellent experience.

Small but delicious menu. Loved the pasta with smoked cheddar, mushrooms, and creamed corn the night we went. Also the arancini in saffron honey was incredible. Always a reliably good meal at this cozy neighborhood spot with fantastic, helpful service. Never had the chance to sit in their garden but I hear it's great

I love this place. It’s such a gem. The owner is friendly and helpful regarding the wine list. My favorite dish is the anchovy pasta and cacio  e pepe. I judge Italian restaurants by their ability to execute this dish. Here they master it. I will say, the dishes are on the pricier side for the neighborhood and portions, but it’s warranted, the ingredients are high quality. I think the arancini would be more interesting if it had peas or ragu.
The food was very delicious, and the service was impeccable!
Food was fantastic
Excellent modern Italian cooking, fantastic staff and a relaxed setting. Sit at the bar or outside and share everything
Nice bar with a nice patio where you can enjoy some drinks and play. The spritz is really good.
Neat neighborhood Italian. Good cocktails. Nice wine list. Food interesting and the menu changes regularly. Backyard with bouche court for summer afternoons.
Great service, very good food with interesting flavors. Definitely will go back.

What a gem - would advice at least one visit to Popina if you are in the area.  Have been to the restaurant a number of times. Food is fresh & different from your run of the mill Italian.  I would say that the Hot Chicken Milanese was a top ten dish for me in the greater New York area.  Not to mention that outside area that is especially great for hanging out in the sun or playing bocce. Would give this place 6 stars if possible!
Excellent food  great wine pairing . Wonderful helpful owners and staff .
Delicious home made pasta and yummy arancini. Friendly service and perfect portion sizes that make you focus on quality not quantity.
Delicious tapas. The octopus was my fave. Good for light bites, not a heavy meal.

Food was excellent but overpriced... $19 for a small serving of pasta is too expensive for a neighborhood spot in my opinion. Waitress acted overly formal for a picnic table which diminished the dining experience compared to the quality of the food.
2 words - HOT CHICKEN. My god.... I would marry it if I could <3

4.14.20 - Surprisingly great food. The butter anchovy pasta was balanced and savory. The chicken cutlet was very well done, although my half was not as juicy. The seafood appetizer was very nice and robust with the legumes. The only gripe I have is the portions are less than what the price would ask for. Nevertheless, I would go back for the anchovy butter pasta.  There's a back yard with a bacci ball field, a few tables and chairs and a lot of standing room.
Amazing pasta, good wine with excellent service!
Great service great food
Terrific food
local homey and deliciously will be back!!
Great little spot with a friendly staff.

Really excellent food in a cozy spot.  The Italian style dishes are enhanced with the flavors of southern food like ham, collards, and red peas and the combination works perfectly.  Make sure to try a pasta dish along with the squid appetizer.  Also, the chocolate pie is one of the best desserts I've ever tried at a restaurant
Neighborhood charmer with a fantastic waitstaff and delicious food
Food was good, it had Thai food that was not rice noodles based which was a fun change from the US norm.

Fantastic and unpretentious. Come as you are, leave full, happy, satiated... Get the brussel sprouts, any and all pasta; the hot chicken is a must, and don't skip dessert. Do yourself a favor and make the walk in the winter months as the cozy ambiance is just the ticket with a chill in the air.
Excellent pasta, arancini, and chicken Milanese. Service was friendly and attentive.
This place is a gem. One dish better than the next. Highly recommend making the trip over.
Great place good service fresh food fast and friendly service chocolate cake was awesome....

Popina is a tiny little Italian restaurant on the edge of Carroll Gardens nor far from the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal and Brooklyn Bridge Park. The Negroni was tempting, but I ultimately settled on ordering a peppery red wine to accompany my meal. We tried two starters - the arancini (love) and the meatballs. We also tried the cavatelli and the pappardelle because they are the two homemade pastas on the menu (the other two are imported). The waiter was attentive and took time to explain each dish.  Overall, it wasn't my favorite place ever, but it was tasty. I appreciated the unique Southern (American) flavors infused into classic Italian dishes. At the end of the meal, while we signed the check, a cockroach crawled across the wall of the restaurant directly towards my seat. I jumped up out of the way so that it wouldn't crawl on me or in my purse. We left our signed receipts on the bar and left. I didn't receive any sort of apology or acknowledgement from the staff who tried to catch/kill the roach, which was disappointing. Maybe I'll try Popina again next year.
Burrata with heirloom tomatoes and pesto was fantastic!
Swordfish was amazing!  And the wine list absolutely on point. Will be back soon!

Great spot and outdoor space. Sat at the bar and soaked in the ambiance while enjoying delicious appetizers and selections from the wine list. Servers were friendly and attentative. Can't wait to return and see what the team has in store as expecting big things.
Tasty, Innovative, fun, approachable, beautiful wine list. Experienced peeps running the show. #popinalife
Top notch hospitality and food from guys who really know what they're doing. This is going to be an awesome neighborhood spot with a beautiful back yard
